Description: Vase of dull red pottery with a red slip: the body of the vase is globular, the sides converging at the top to a short narrow neck with an external roll rim. Good condition, although slightly chipped at the rim.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton, G. Brunton, 'Qau and Badari' I (London, 1927), pl.XI; pot typed by excavator as 87P, for which see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Tarkhan' II (London, 1914), pl.XXXI.
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
